intro: Pimpinella laciniata, commonly known as the cut-leaved cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and medicinal studies.
